p: On the other hand, the use of diverse diagnostic techniques for the same disease makes the data difficult to harmonize and compare among the studies across space and time. Studies were conducted using tests with different sensitivities, especially for infections detected by microscopy in feces samples, such as S. mansoni and STH. In particular, only one study used Baermann technique for S. stercoralis identification, the most sensitive microscopy test nowadays for this parasite [ 90]. In addition, some surveys identified the NTD as a secondary effect of the main study endpoint, thus, the epidemiological parameter could be biased by report or measurement.
